intro: Sweetia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian sweetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Sweetia panamensis typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
